job_history.work_description: Report to one of the 4 Regional Vice Presidents of the company. Work with regional business leaders in providing innovative HR solutions to make business strategies actionable. Provide progressive HR guidelines, while ensuring that all HR programs are in accordance with the business needs, local labor laws and culture. Partnered with the Performance and Growth, Total Rewards and Harley-Davidson University Centers of Excellence (COE), as well as with the executive management, in executing agreed strategic plan in support of organizational programs.

Responsible for the development and implementation of corporate HR plans and policies in support of the business plan, while ensuring HR regulatory and legal compliance. Carried out a broad range of HR functions, including employee recruitment and training, benefits administration, as well as overseeing disciplinary action and managing HR records.

Inspired and retained a high-performing diverse workforce for the district, building upon the foundation of success as key member of the store management team, Administered effective management and execution of learning, career development, employment practices, recognition and reward, staffing, performance management systems, and compliance programs, while fostering a positive associate relations environment.

Provided consultative direction for ground floor HR infrastructure and organizational efficiency of start-up company for multiple, high-profile client projects, such as Panasonic, LeapFrog, and AIG. Oversaw the development of compensation functions including job analysis, salary administration, and job evaluation system as key business partner of leadership team.

skills.name: Human Resources
skills.explanation: Over 20 years of experience in various HR roles, including HR Manager and Regional HR Business Partner, demonstrating expert-level mastery of HR functions.

skills.name: Leadership
skills.explanation: Held leadership positions in multiple companies, including a startup, and partnered with executive management to execute strategic plans, indicating expert-level leadership skills.

skills.name: Recruitment
skills.explanation: Responsible for employee recruitment in multiple roles, suggesting strong proficiency in recruitment processes.

skills.name: Training and Development
skills.explanation: Carried out employee training and development functions, including career development and learning programs, indicating strong proficiency.

skills.name: Benefits Administration
skills.explanation: Administered benefits programs as part of HR responsibilities, showing a solid working proficiency.

skills.name: Compliance
skills.explanation: Ensured compliance with HR regulations and laws in multiple roles, demonstrating a solid understanding of compliance requirements.

skills.name: Performance Management
skills.explanation: Managed performance management systems in multiple roles, showing a solid working proficiency.

skills.name: Compensation and Rewards
skills.explanation: Developed and administered compensation functions, including job analysis and salary administration, indicating a solid working proficiency.

skills.name: Organizational Development
skills.explanation: Provided consultative direction for HR infrastructure and organizational efficiency in a startup company, showing a solid working proficiency.
